row.title: Rare Brain and Spine Tumors
row.field_page_description: Learn about NCI-CONNECT selected rare adult CNS tumor type grades, features, causes, symptoms, who gets which tumors, how and where they form, and treatments.
row.field_feature_card_description: Learn about NCI-CONNECT selected rare adult CNS tumor type grades, features, causes, symptoms, who gets which tumors, how and where they form, and treatments.
row.field_list_description: Learn about NCI-CONNECT selected rare adult CNS tumor type grades, features, causes, symptoms, who gets which tumors, how and where they form, and treatments.
row.intro:
Primary central nervous system (CNS) tumors begin in the brain or spinal cord. About 79,000 people are diagnosed a year with a primary CNS tumor and about 24,000 are malignant. View Cancer Stat Facts: Brain and Other Nervous System Cancer to see the number of new cases, lifetime risk, and people living with CNS cancers in the United States. All primary CNS cancers are rare, so often disease information, support, and expert care is hard to find.

Learn about CNS tumor anatomy, causes, symptoms, diagnosis, treatments, and who they affect to help you better understand your cancer so you can feel confident in your care.

row.title: Rare Brain and Spine Tumor Clinical Studies
row.field_page_description: Learn about clinical trials and research studies for adult patients with rare brain and spine tumors.
row.field_feature_card_description: NCI-CONNECT has studies available that focus on rare central nervous system tumors.
row.field_list_description: NCI-CONNECT has studies available that focus on rare central nervous system tumors.

row.title: Guiding Questions
row.field_page_description: Use these questions to help patients with a rare brain or spine tumor find expert care and make care and treatment decisions.
row.field_feature_card_description: Use these questions to help you find expert care and make care and treatment decisions.
row.field_list_description: Use these questions to help you find expert care and make care and treatment decisions.

row.title: Refer and Participate
row.field_page_description: Learn how to refer patients, participate in a clinical trial or research study, and be a partner with the Cancer Moonshot project focused on rare adult brain and spine tumors.
row.field_feature_card_description: NCI-CONNECT wants to connect patients, providers, researchers, and community organizations to work in partnership to improve outcomes for adult patients with rare CNS tumors.
row.field_list_description: NCI-CONNECT wants to connect patients, providers, researchers, and community organizations to work in partnership to improve outcomes for adult patients with rare CNS tumors.
row.intro:
NCI-CONNECT wants to connect patients, providers, researchers, and community organizations to work in partnership to improve outcomes for adult patients with rare central nervous system (CNS) tumors.

Learn how you can participate in NCI-CONNECT.

row.title: Living with a Brain or Spine Tumor
row.field_short_title: Living with a Brain or Spine Tumor
row.field_page_description: View questions to ask your healthcare team, ways to cope, treatment and support resources, and hear from patients and caregivers living with rare brain and spine tumors to guide you through your journey.
row.field_feature_card_description: View questions to ask your healthcare team, ways to cope, treatment and support resources, and hear from patients and caregivers living with rare brain and spine tumors to guide you through your journey.
row.field_list_description: View questions to ask your healthcare team, ways to cope, treatment and support resources, and hear from patients and caregivers living with rare central nervous system tumors to guide you through your journey.
row.field_browser_title: Living with a Rare Brain or Spine Tumor
row.field_card_title: Living with a Brain or Spine Tumor
row.intro: Living with a rare brain or spine tumor can impact all aspects of your life. Physical or thinking and memory changes can be caused by the tumor, removal of the tumor, or treatment and can affect your quality of life. This can be challenging for you and your loved ones. And in each stage of your cancer journey, you will face unique challenges. View questions to ask your healthcare team, ways to cope, and treatment and support resources. Hear from patients and caregivers living with rare central nervous system (CNS) tumors to guide you through your journey.

row.field_page_description: Get advice, tips, support, and inspiration from patients and caregivers living with a rare CNS tumor.
